Posts.Title: Healed from prostatectomy, PSA at 4.7 after 5 Months, what's next?

Posts.Content: Hi, Had my Prostatectomy in Feb 2018. March PSA was 2.7. Pathology Report showed Metastatic Cancer, found in 7 Lymph nodes and seminal tubes. PSA up to 4.7 in June. Recheck with Surgeon 7/3/18 and he wants to refer me to medical and radiation oncologist. I am hesitant to rush to see them. I'm starting a new job Tuesday and I want to settle in before I commit to a bunch of new treatments. I'm also a little tired of bouncing around the medical establishment. I don't think I want Hormone Therapy, I'll do radiation but there are no guarantees as we all know. Any harm in waiting a while? Can anyone think of other options? Thanks, Lantz
Posts.Title: Healed from prostatectomy, PSA at 4.7 after 5 Months, what's next?

Posts.Title: Healed from prostatectomy, PSA at 4.7 after 5 Months, what's next?

Posts.Content: Thanks for all the replies and feedback. I don't think I have any option but to get thru it and hope for the best. This is where the "tough get going" and I have to be tough for my little girls. Thanks again everyone, Lantz

Posts.Title: Starting Hormone Therapy and 8 weeks of Radiation-How to deal with fatigue

Posts.Content: Hi, I'm back for more advice. I had my first consult with Oncologist. My surgeon finally referred me over to him. I've got a couple months of Hormone Therapy and then 8 weeks, 40 radiation treatments to look forward to. I have to keep working. I don't want work to know about it. I'm a contractor. I hear you can get tired, fatigued after starting radiation. I guess I'll have to drive and hour 15 to work, work 9 hours, hour and 15 home then radiation. Does anyone have any tips for dealing with the fatigue? I'm tired already, without the radiation but I do have every other Friday off. I've read about provigil that people take to deal with daytime tiredness from "shift work". It's not an amphetamine but "promotes wakefulness". Do Drs prescribe anything like this to combat the tiredness? Does anybody have any advice along this line. I'm a little worried about falling asleep while I'm driving. I don't have shortterm disability .I'm on my wife's insurance since Bristol-Myers Squibb laid me off for getting too old. Ironic, the big cancer drug company. Thanks, Lantz

Posts.Title: Starting Hormone Therapy and 8 weeks of Radiation-How to deal with fatigue

Posts.Content: Thanks for all the replies. I started ADT this morning. It's the pills that I take for 2 weeks prior to the first injection. After 2 months of ADT I'll begin the 8 weeks of Radiation. I'm 61 for the record. Fully continent. I'm at Memorial Sloan Kettering. I thought they were supposed to be really good. They were my third opinion before my surgery. Nobody seems to be in any big hurry there though. I get so many different reactions from people about the seriousness of my situation. It's confusing. Well, I'm on my way now.
Posts.Signature: Many Thanks, Lantz Pre-Surgical PSA 5.9 RALP on 2/9/2018 Adenocarcinoma, G 9 (4+5) Intraductal Carcinoma: Extensive Tumor involves: R posterior, R anterior, L posterior, L anterior Left pelvic lymph nodes: 2 of 6 positive for metastatic prostatic adenocarcinoma Extranodal extension identified Right pelvic lymph nodes: 5 of 12 positive for metastatic prostatic adenocarcinoma Extranodal extension identified SM+, EPE+, SVI+, LVI+, PNI+ Post-RP PSA : 1 Month: 2.7 6 Months: 4.7
Posts.Title: Rising PSA after RP

Posts.Content: I had my RP 2/9/18. PSAs have been rising since March. Now up to 6.74, 7 months later. My MRI just came back completely clean. I'm talking to the oncologists about starting ADT and salvage radiation. In their terms they are "throwing the book" at the cancer. I expressed my reservations about ADT to the medical oncologists and she just said "we can't make you take it". She had had a long day and i was her last patient. She had been seeing "really sick people" before me snd was 1.5 hours late. How bad is the rising PSA in tge scheme of things?

Posts.Title: Rising PSA after RP

Posts.Content: Ok. Point made. I don't know why the treatment has been delayed so long.
